definition: to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
muscle/tendon/veins visible under the skin/sth resembling tendons or veins (e.g. fiber in a vegetable)
abbr. for the Big Dipper constellation 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1]
to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together
dry measure for grain equal to ten 升[sheng1] or one-tenth of a 石[dan4]/decaliter/peck/cup or dipper shaped object/old variant of 陡[dou3]

sentences.english: He practised standing on his head and turning somersaults .
To perform acrobatic feats such as somersaults, rolls, or twists.
sentences.chinese: 表演杂技如翻筋斗，翻滚或旋转。

sentences.english: The acrobats tumbled over the stage.
sentences.chinese: 杂技演员们在舞台上翻筋斗。

sentences.english: I like standing on my head! I can do a somersault.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢倒立，我会翻筋斗。

sentences.english: And when you did the outside loop last week.
sentences.chinese: 你上周驾飞机在空中翻筋斗。

sentences.english: Do you know how to do a somersault.
The airman looped the loop eight times.
sentences.chinese: 那位飞行员作了八次翻筋斗的飞行表演。

sentences.english: He drank up a tumbler of milk.
sentences.chinese: 他年轻时是个翻筋斗的杂技演员。

sentences.english: Two girls and a boy had even achieved back handsprings on their own.
sentences.chinese: 两个女孩和一个男孩甚至都能独立完成反向翻筋斗了。

sentences.english: In traditional opera a comedian in military plays often cartwheels on the stage.
sentences.chinese: 在旧剧中，武丑常常在戏台上横翻筋斗。

definition: to do a somersault/to turn head over heels
a handstand/to turn upside down/to stand on one's head/upside down
drill (in sword play)/to thrash around/to demonstrate gymnastic skills/to solicit financial help (in an indirect way)/to show off
